intro: Galatella linosyris subsp. pontica, commonly known as the Pontic galatella, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as coastal areas and cliffs. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
